infoIntro: Buffon's Needle is a probability experiment first posed by the French mathematician Georges-Louis Leclerc, Comte de Buffon in 1733. It is one of the oldest problems in geometric probability and provides a surprising way to estimate the value of $\pi$ using nothing but randomness and geometry.
infoSetup: A floor is ruled with parallel lines spaced a distance $d$ apart. A needle of length $l$ is dropped randomly onto the floor. We ask: what is the probability that the needle crosses one of the lines?
